sentence: Chicago, IL- August 28, 2015 - Today, Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights Features: Nutrisystem, Inc. ( NTRI ), Chuy's Holdings, Inc. ( CHUY ), Columbia Sportswear Company ( COLM ), Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) and Express, Inc. ( EXPR ).
After a three year rally, the stock market has finally had a correction.
Now is the time to find some deals.
But with nearly every stock, in every sector, extremely volatile, it's easy for investors to get confused as to what constitutes a real deal.
Don't lose sight of the fundamentals.
Always buy the best companies with the best earnings outlook.

Look for the "Beat and Raise"

Wall Street is just finishing up another earnings season.
Despite all the doom and gloom being touted out there, it wasn't all bad.
Some companies not only beat the quarterly earnings estimate but they raised full year guidance.
This is what is routinely referred to as the "beat and raise."
Only the top companies did it this quarter.
They are seeing even better things developing as the year goes on.
In this week of market turmoil, why not only focus on the best?

5 Beat and Raise Stocks to Buy Now

All 5 of these stocks are Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) or #2 (Buy) stocks.
That means they have rising earnings estimates which makes sense as they recently raised full year guidance so analysts have had to boost estimates to keep up.
Nutrisystem sells weight loss programs to men and women in the United States.
Health and wellness has come into the spotlight, including better eating.
The company beat by 4 cents last quarter and raised full year earnings and revenue guidance.
Earnings are now expected to be in the range of $0.87 to $0.97 up from its previous guidance of $0.81 to $0.91.
The full year outlook is looking a lot more bullish than it did earlier in the year when the company was only looking for $0.73 to $0.83.
It beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 6 cents in the second quarter as same-store-sales rose 3.2%.
It raised full year earnings to a range of $0.82-$0.85 from its prior guidance of $0.76-$0.79 as its made-from-scratch brand of TexMex food continues to be popular with customers.
Columbia Sportswear makes active lifestyle apparel, footwear, accessories and equipment under several well known brands including Columbia, Sorel, prAna, Montrail and OutDry.
It beat the Zacks Consensus by 13 cents in the second quarter as net sales rose 17%.
Columbia was bullish about the rest of the year saying that it entered the fall season with "robust momentum."
It raised full year earnings outlook to growth in the range of 17% to 22%.
The Home Depot is the largest home improvement retailer with 2,270 retail stores in all 50 states, DC, Puerto Rico, US Virgin Islands, Guam, 10 Canadian provinces and Mexico.
In the second quarter, Home Depot beat by a penny as same-store-sales rose 4.2% system wide and gained 5.7% in the US.
It saw a record number of transactions in the last 3 months as sales momentum built over the summer.
Sales went from 3.5% in May all the way up to 8% in July.
Given its strong numbers and the momentum in the housing industry, Home Depot raised fiscal 2015 full year EPS and sales guidance.
Comparable sales are expected to be up in the range of 4.1% to 4.9%.
Express operates 600 retail and factory outlet stores selling specialty apparel and accessories for 20 to 30 year old men and women in the United States, Canada, and Puerto Rico.
It beat the Zacks Consensus by 10 cents in the second quarter on record sales.
Comparable store sales rose 7% while e-commerce sales spiked 21%.
Inventory management and a product mix that was on trend meant it did fewer promotions in the quarter.
With these solid results heading into the back half of the year, Express raised its full year guidance and analysts have boosted their earnings estimates as a result.
